record.text: Red Hat Hit by Data Breach, Hackers Exploit GitLab Instance #Cloud #GitHub #GitLab

external.description:
An extortion gang by the name of Crimson Collective claimed to have stolen approximately 570GB of compressed data from internal development repositories belonging to Red Hat. Red Hat confirmed the breach impacted one of its GitLab instances.



The stolen data contains around 800 Customer Engagement Reports (CERs), which contain sensitive data about a customer’s platform and network. A CER is a consulting document made for clients that includes infrastructure data, configuration details, authentication tokens, and other data that could be exploited to attack customer networks. 

Red Hat confirmed that it was hit by a security breach impacting its consulting business, but it has not confirmed any of the threat actor’s claims about the stolen GitLab repositories and customer CERs. 

According to Bleeping Computer’s conversation with the hacker, the breach happened two weeks ago. Threat actors allegedly accessed the full database URIs, authentication tokens, and private data in Red Hat CERs and code. They claim that the data was used to get access to the downstream customer infrastructure.

The hacking gang also released a full directory containing the list of the allegedly extracted GitLab repositories and a list of CERs between 2020 and 2025 on Telegram. 

The directory list of CERs contains various sectors and famous organizations like AT&T, Fidelity, Kaiser, Bank of America, Mayo Clinic,  T-Mobile, Costco, Federal Aviation Administration, the US Navy’s Naval Surface Warfare Center, the House of Representatives, etc. 

The hackers claim they contacted Red Hat with an extortion ransom, but did not get any reply except a message asking the hackers to provide a vulnerability report to Red Hat’s security team.

"We recently detected unauthorized access to a GitLab instance used for internal Red Hat Consulting collaboration in select engagements. Upon detection, we promptly launched a thorough investigation, removed the unauthorized party’s access, isolated the instance, and contacted the appropriate authorities. Our ongoing investigation found that an unauthorized third party had accessed and copied some data from this instance," said Red Hat.
external.title: Red Hat Hit by Data Breach, Hackers Exploit GitLab Instance

record.text: Telstra Denies Scattered Spider Data Breach Claims Amid Ransom Threats #DataBreach #DataExposure #DataLeak

external.description:
Telstra, one of Australia’s leading telecommunications companies, has denied claims made by the hacker group Scattered Spider that it suffered a massive data breach compromising nearly 19 million personal records. The company issued a statement clarifying that its internal systems remain secure and that the data in question was scraped from publicly available sources rather than stolen. In a post on X (formerly Twitter), Telstra emphasized that no passwords, banking details, or sensitive identification data such as driver’s licenses or Medicare numbers were included in the dataset. 
The claims originated from a dark web post published on October 3 by a group calling itself Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters, an offshoot of Scattered Spider. The group alleged it had stolen more than 100GB of personally identifiable information, including names and physical addresses, and warned that company executives should negotiate to avoid further data exposure. The attackers claimed the alleged breach took place in July 2023 and threatened to release the data publicly if a ransom was not paid by October 13, 2025. They also asserted possession of over 16 million records contained in a file named telstra.sql, which they said was part of a larger collection of 19 million records. 
In a surprising twist, the ransom note also mentioned Salesforce, the global cloud computing company, demanding negotiations begin with its executives. Salesforce swiftly rejected the demand, issuing a statement on October 8 declaring that it “will not engage, negotiate with, or pay any extortion demand,” aligning with global cybersecurity guidelines that discourage ransom payments. 
Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters has made similar claims about breaches involving several major corporations, including Qantas, IKEA, and Google AdSense. Cybersecurity intelligence platforms like Cyble Vision have documented multiple previous instances of alleged Telstra data breaches, some dating back to 2022. In one notable case, a threat actor called UnicornLover67 claimed to possess a dataset containing over 47,000 Telstra employee records, including email addresses and hashed passwords. Telstra has previously confirmed smaller breaches linked to third-party service providers, most recently in 2022, affecting around 132,000 customers. 
However, cybersecurity analysts remain uncertain whether the current claims represent a fresh breach or a recycling of old data. Experts suggest that previously leaked or publicly available datasets may have been repurposed to appear as new evidence of compromise. This possibility aligns with Telstra’s statement that no recent intrusion has occurred. 
The investigation into the alleged breach remains ongoing as the ransom deadline approaches. While Telstra continues to assert that its systems are uncompromised, the persistence of repeated breach claims underscores the growing challenge of misinformation and data reuse in the cybercrime landscape. The Cyber Express has reached out to Telstra for further updates and will continue to monitor the situation as new details emerge.
external.title: Telstra Denies Scattered Spider Data Breach Claims Amid Ransom Threats

record.text: Illumio Report Warns: Lateral Movement, Not Breach Entry, Causes the Real Cybersecurity Damage #clouddetectionandresponse #CyberSecurity #cybersecuritytrends2025

external.description:
In most cyberattacks, the real challenge doesn’t begin at the point of entry—it starts afterward. Once cybercriminals infiltrate a system, they move laterally across networks, testing access points, escalating privileges, and expanding control until a small breach becomes a full-scale compromise. Despite decades of technological progress, the core lesson remains: total prevention is impossible, and it’s the spread of an attack that does the deepest damage.
Illumio’s 2025 Global Cloud Detection and Response Report echoes this reality. Although many organizations claim to monitor east-west traffic and hybrid communications, few possess the contextual clarity to interpret the data effectively. Collecting logs and flow metrics is easy; understanding which workloads interact—and whether that interaction poses a risk—is where visibility breaks down.
Illumio founder and CEO Andrew Rubin highlighted this disconnect: “Everybody loves to say that we’ve got a data or a telemetry problem. I actually think that may be the biggest fallacy of all. We have more data and telemetry than we’ve ever had. The problem is we haven’t figured out how to use it in a highly efficient, highly effective way.”
The report reveals how overwhelmed security teams are by alert fatigue. Thousands of daily notifications—many of them false positives—leave analysts sifting through noise, hoping to identify the few signals that matter. Some describe it as “alert triage roulette,” where the odds of catching a genuine attack indicator are slim.
This inefficiency is costly. Missed alerts lead to prolonged downtime and severe financial losses. Rubin stressed that attackers often stay hidden for months: “Attackers are getting in. They’re literally moving into our house and living with us for months, totally undetected. That means we’re flying blind.”
Despite the adoption of advanced tools like CDR, NDR, XDR, SIEM, and SOAR, blind spots persist. The cybersecurity industry keeps adding layers of detection, but without correlation and context, more data simply amplifies the noise.
Shifting the Security Focus
The narrative now needs to move from “more detection” to “greater observability and containment.” Observability provides enriched context—who’s accessing what, from where, and how critical it is—across clouds and data centers, visualizing potential attack paths and blast radii. Containment acts on that insight, ideally through automation, to isolate or block threats before they escalate.
Rubin summarized it succinctly: “If you want to limit the blast radius of an attack, there are only two things you can do: find it quickly, and segment the environment. They are the only controls that help.”
Heading into 2026, organizations are prioritizing AI and machine learning integration, cloud detection and response, and faster incident remediation. As Rubin noted, AI is transforming both defense and offense in cybersecurity: “AI is going to be a tool in the hands of both the defenders and the attackers forever. In the short term, the advantage probably goes to those who operate outside the rule of law. The one thing we can do to combat that is better observability and finding things faster than we have in the past.”
Ultimately, the report reinforces one truth: visibility without understanding is useless. Companies that convert visibility into context, and context into containment, will stay ahead. In cybersecurity, speed and clarity will always triumph over noise and volume.

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Are Ghosts Real? What Experts Say About Paranormal Activity" on @Spreaker #activity #ghosts #paranormal

external.description: The source provides an extensive overview of the enduring debate surrounding the existence of ghosts, examining the topic through multiple viewpoints including science, skepticism, history, and paranormal research. It explains that while ghosts are a nearly universal cultural construct used to process loss and societal fears, a significant percentage of the population reports personal encounters, prompting scientific investigation. Skeptical perspectives offer neurological and environmental explanations for sightings, such as pareidolia, sleep paralysis, and infrasound, while paranormal researchers rely on observational evidence from tools like EMF meters to argue that some phenomena defy natural explanations. Ultimately, the episode concludes that the mystery persists, with some experts suggesting ghosts may be a combination of psychological, environmental, and currently undiscovered factors related to consciousness or energy.
external.title: Are Ghosts Real? What Experts Say About Paranormal Activity

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Daughter of the ‘BTK Killer’ Breaks Silence in Shocking Netflix Documentary" on @Spreaker #btk #documentary #killer #netflix

external.description: The source provides an extensive overview of the life and crimes of serial killer Dennis Rader, known as the BTK Killer, focusing heavily on the resulting trauma experienced by his family, particularly his daughter, Kerri Rawson. It details Rader’s dual life as a seemingly normal family man and church leader while he terrorized Wichita, Kansas, by committing at least 10 sadistic murders between 1974 and 1991. The episode discusses Rawson’s memoir and the upcoming Netflix documentary My Father, the BTK Killer, which is described as her final public attempt to process the betrayal, trauma, and improbable path toward forgiveness. The narrative contrasts the killer's monstrous actions and narcissism—which led to his 2005 arrest—with Rawson’s journey as a "secondary victim" who reclaims her narrative and advocates for other survivors of familial evil.
external.title: Daughter of the ‘BTK Killer’ Breaks Silence in Shocking Netflix Documentary

external.description: The sources provide an extensive overview of Taylor Sheridan's dominant presence on the Paramount+ streaming service, focusing specifically on his Fall 2025 programming slate of neo-Western and crime dramas. The episode confirms that three key series—Tulsa King Season 3, Mayor of Kingstown Season 4, and Landman Season 2—are scheduled for release between September and November 2025, with a potential fourth show, Special Ops: Lioness Season 3, remaining a wildcard due to merger concerns. A supplementary source then offers a highly detailed, spoiler-filled plot summary of Landman Season 2, outlining the dramatic events faced by Billy Bob Thornton's character, Tommy Norris, as he navigates corporate intrigue, cartel conflicts, and family betrayals within the volatile West Texas oil industry. Collectively, the texts emphasize Sheridan's prolific output, strategic release calendar, and the high stakes facing his interconnected universe of shows.

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Rich, Famous, & SUICIDAL: Leo Tolstoy's Search for the Meaning of LIFE" on @Spreaker #bigquestions #compassion #existentialcrisis #existentialism #findingmeaning #greatauthors #happiness #inspiration #leotolstoy #lifelessons #meaningoflife #philosophy #podcast #purpose #wisdom

external.description:
What if you achieved everything you ever wanted—fame, wealth, genius—and it left you feeling so empty that you had to hide the ropes in your house to keep from ending it all? This isn't a hypothetical. This was the terrifying reality for Leo Tolstoy, one of the greatest writers in history.

Welcome to the podcast that follows a literary giant into the abyss of his existential crisis and back out into the light. At the height of his success, Tolstoy was haunted by one question: what is the meaning of life? His search for an answer drove him through the halls of science and philosophy, but they all came up empty.

The answer, when it finally came, wasn't found in a book or a formula. It was found in the dirt-stained hands and simple faith of peasants. We’ll explore Tolstoy's revolutionary discovery that the true purpose of our existence lies not in what we achieve, but in how we love, serve, and connect with others. This revelation so shattered his world that he gave up his wealth, rejected his status, and dedicated his life to a radical new path of spirituality and compassion.

This isn't just a story about a 19th-century author. It's a timeless roadmap for anyone who has ever felt that there must be more than this.

If you're searching for your own answers, subscribe now. Join us on a journey to find meaning in a world obsessed with the meaningless.
external.title: Rich, Famous, & SUICIDAL: Leo Tolstoy's Search for the Meaning of LIFE

external.description:
While you were busy scrolling, the robot revolution quietly went into overdrive. This isn't a forecast or a "what if" scenario. This is a dispatch from the front lines of a future that is being built right now.

Welcome to your essential global briefing on Robotics and AI. Forget theory—we're talking about the mind-bending breakthroughs that just happened. We’ll take you inside UC Berkeley's labs where shape-shifting robots are using Artificial Intelligence to learn on the fly. We'll show you the tiny soft robots from China that can crawl, swim, and carry cargo. Then, we’ll jet to South Korea to witness the unveiling of the new humanoid robot, Capeex, and a massive robot sports festival that looks like a real-life blockbuster.

But it’s not all hardware. We're diving headfirst into the controversy shaking Hollywood to its core: the rise of fully AI-generated synthetic actors. From the shipyard floor where spider-like robots are building our world, to the silver screen where humans are being replaced, this is the future of technology—unfiltered and unbelievable.

If you want to understand the world that’s being built around you while you sleep, subscribe and share this episode. You need to hear this.
external.title: Hollywood's AI CLONES & The Robots That Build Themselves

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "The Chilling LINK Between 3I/ATLAS and the WOW Signal (45-Year-Old Mystery Solved)" on @Spreaker #3iatlas #aliens #alientechnology #arewealone #astronomy #comet #cosmology #extraterrestrial #interstellarobject #mystery #oumuamua #podcast #science #space #spaceexploration #uap

external.description:
What if the single greatest discovery in human history is flying past us right now, and we're calling it a comet? In the cold, silent dark of space, an object named 3I Atlas is breaking all the rules of astronomy, and the official explanations are starting to fall apart.

Welcome to the investigation that puts science on the edge of the unbelievable. We're diving deep into the enigma of 3I Atlas, the interstellar object that baffles scientists. It glows a ghostly green, but the chemical that should be causing it is missing. It's shedding metal in the freezing void, a process that shouldn't be possible. Most chillingly, it flies with an unnervingly steady velocity, ignoring the forces that push every other comet off course. This has led some scientists to whisper the forbidden question: is it natural... or is it alien technology?

But here's the clue that changes everything. Its trajectory traces back to the exact same point in the sky as the legendary 1977 "WOW Signal"—the most famous potential extraterrestrial broadcast ever detected. Coincidence? Or the arrival of a 45-year-old message?

Join us as we connect the dots, analyze the evidence, and explore the mind-bending possibility that we are not alone. Subscribe now, share this with every sky-watcher you know, and decide for yourself if this is the ultimate mystery or the beginning of a new chapter for humanity.
external.title: The Chilling LINK Between 3I/ATLAS and the WOW Signal (45-Year-Old Mystery Solved)

▼詳細はこちら

external.description: Watfordは、Paulo Pezzolano監督がエージェントArnaud Mogi Bayatに関連する選手を起用する圧力に抵抗したため解任されたと報じられている。しかし、クラブ側はこの主張を否定している。Pezzolano監督は、5ヶ月間の任期を経て解任され、Javi Graciaが2度目の就任を果たした。解任の理由として、Bayatに関連する選手の起用を拒んだことが影響したとの説があり、特にMoussa SissokoやLuca Kjerrumgaard、Pierre Dwomohなどが挙げられた。Pezzolanoは特定の選手を起用するよう直接的な指示を受けたわけではないが、上層部からその理由を頻繁に問われていた。Bayatは選手起用に影響を与えたことを強く否定しており、また自身に対する不正疑惑も抱えている。WatfordはPezzolanoの解任後、Javi Graciaの指導で安定性を求めていると伝えている。

record.text:
真の愛国心とは何か？ゲイリー・ネビルが旗の本質を問い直す時 - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
サッカー界は今、サポーターの感情と政治の渦中にある。ウェンブリーの観客が「ゲーリー・ネビルはアホだ」と叫ぶ中、著名なサッカー選手ジョーイ・バートンが障害者に対する暴力を招くような発言をしたことが問題視されている。

ネビルは、英愛国心が現代において武器として使われることに反対の立場を取っており、愛国心を「ただの布の色」と冷静に分析している。彼の見解は多くの批判を浴びつつも、イギリス社会における愛国心の本質は「無関心に生きる自由」であると指摘している。

さらに、サッカーが現社会の「軍国主義」に取り込まれている現状を強く指摘し、ネビルの発言は一種の警鐘とも言える。特に、愛国心のあり方は時代と共に変わるべきだという意見を強調し、オーウェルの思想に触れながら新たな英愛国心の形を模索している。

彼は、極端な政治運動や分断を助長するような行動には異議を唱えるべきとし、現代のサッカーが抱える多くの問題を解決するための議論の必要性を訴えている。最終的に、ネビルの姿勢は、現在のイギリス社会において重要な同調性を求める発信とも取れる。

record.text:
オルモ、筋肉の不調で代表合宿を途中離脱。月曜日にバルセロナで追加検査へ - AIサッカーまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
ダニ・オルモは、左脚のふくらはぎに違和感を感じながらも、代表での活躍を目指していた。バルセロナではフェルミンに代わって出場機会を失い、代表でも出場時間がなかったが、FIFAウィークに良いパフォーマンスを見せようと努力していた。しかし、練習中に違和感を訴え、最終的にはジオルギアとブルガリア戦を欠場することになった。

スペインサッカー連盟（RFEF）は、オルモが月曜日にキャンプに到着した時点で筋肉疲労の兆候があったと報告。治療を受けながら調整を続けていたが、最終的に左脚にさらなる不快感を感じ、15分後に練習を中止し、検査を受けることとなった。月曜日にはバルセロナで追加の検査を受ける予定だ。

バルセロナと連携を取りながら、オルモの状態に関しては慎重に対応している。代表監督ルイス・デ・ラ・フエンテは、オルモの怪我を気にかけ、「どの選手の怪我も心苦しい」とコメントしている。
external.title: オルモ、筋肉の不調で代表合宿を途中離脱。月曜日にバルセロナで追加検査へ - AIサッカーまとめ

external.description: Palisades fire sparks burst of fire BBC A 29-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of starting the fire in Los Angeles' Pacific Palisades that killed 12 people and destroyed more than 6,000 homes in January. Evidence collected from Jonathan Rinderknecht's digital devices included an image he generated on ChatGPT depicting a city on fire, Justice Department officials said. One of the most destructive fires in Los Angeles history, the fire started on January 7 near a walking trail overlooking the affluent coastal neighborhood.

i don’t deny that ai can be useful. but chatgpt 5 style is so viscerally unpleasant to read
90 percent of my new case submissions are clearly written using AI (very clear bc of the bullet point style) and it makes me want to jab my eyes out

Been using ChatGPT extensively for months, please recognise you are working with a drunk that will tell you what it thinks you want to hear. Good at a conceptual level to get you in the ballpark of a new subject area but then do your own research as it is a liability when it comes to detail.

An LLM like ChatGPT wont feed back your corrections to its central learning, it just amends things in your individual context for subsequent output and can store things in your ring fenced memory for subsequent sessions with you. So you cant influence it to give better answers to others for example.

record.text:
And I should clarify, despite the voltage potentials, that's not what's happening in an LLM. An LLM is a mathematical model, like a weather simulator or a nuclear explosion simulator.

The underlying hardware is irrelevant in this comparison, since it's the mathematical model that's in question.

And if you're going to discount the entire field of mathematically modeling physical systems, that's a gigantic discussion.

Like, yes, weather simulations aren't actually creating real hurricanes. But we can simulate them all the same, using maths. Same with nuclear explosions. Tons of things.

According to the panchang, the puja muhurat in Dubai and across the UAE runs from 5:57 PM to 7:11 PM, so that’s your golden window to gather your thali, light the diya, and offer prayers to Goddess for your partner’s long and healthy life.

What are National Insurance and income tax and what could change in the Budget?

Getty Images There has been speculation that November's Budget could see Chancellor Rachel Reeves break Labour's pre-election pledge not to increase income tax, National Insurance (NI) or VAT for working people. It's…

external.description: Getty Images There has been speculation that November's Budget could see Chancellor Rachel Reeves break Labour's pre-election pledge not to increase income tax, National Insurance (NI) or VAT for working people. It's been suggested that she could extend a freeze to the income thresholds at which people start paying the taxes, or have to pay more. What is National Insurance and what does it pay for? The government uses National Insurance to pay benefits and help fund the NHS. It is paid by employees, employers and the self-employed across the UK.
